posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked: The best messenger app, but the worst icons in history! Please, you need to redesign them all… My eyes are suffering!

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: you have to be more specific.

posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked: I love this app it’s the best messaging app! However, I think the icons could use a redesign. They don’t look very appealing and could be improved for a better user experience. Hope this gets addressed!

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: again, you have to elaborate more. which icons bother you? the logo? the tab icons? the entire icon family of the symbolic outlines? what do you imagine them looking like? what specifically bothers you? or is it the only opinion you hold is that they’re bad and that’s it?

posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked:
Setttings → Appearance → App Icon → 12 icons. (iOS)

I think the icons could be better. I’d love to see new ones that fit better on my iPhone home screen. Just to be clear, I’m not trying to be negative. I love the app! But when it comes to icons, I can’t find one that I really like. Other messaging apps seem to have better options, but I won’t name names here.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Why not? You can be clear about what you want. It’s not like you’ll get banned for mentioning other apps here lol.

posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked:
I can’t explain it exactly… it’s not something specific in my mind.

I just feel that the logo needs a redesign, along with the icons inside the app. That’s all.

Maybe others see it differently, and I could be wrong, but that’s just my opinion. At the very least, I think we should have more icons to choose from.

(btw I hate the dotted on the logo xD )

posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked:
Overall, the icons aren’t great. Think about it, a cloud with a moon, a piece of paper, a sketch-like image, and a wave… there’s no real imagination behind them, and some don’t even relate to a messenger app. The only good one is the second icon in the second row, blue and white, without the dashed lines. All the others feel uninspired.

IMG_46151206×2622 118 KB

IMG_4617.PNG1206×2622 56.2 KB

IMG_4616.PNG1206×2622 55 KB

Do you see the difference?

The only good icon is in the last picture… but it still feels like something is missing. It doesn’t quite fit with other messenger apps.

But still, I’ll say it again, Signal is my favorite app. It’s clean, ad-free, safe, and powerful. I love it, and I’m trying to bring my friends here too. I want to use it as my main messaging app, which is why I’m taking the time to help improve its graphics.
Actually these arbitrary looking icons (the paper, writing, weather, waves) were created to use so that a person who is just glancing at your phones’ home screen doesn’t see a Signal icon there.

The image in the last picture is very similar to the stock icon and loses all Signal identity. I think the dotted line resembles encryption, and has become an identification for Signal. Maybe I just became attached to it… I like it.

posts.name: Yadir
posts.cooked: From my perspective and respecting your opinion, I believe that the icons of Signal are some of the best, simple and descriptive. I think they should improve on compressing the chat list a bit, just a little, place the access to the camera in another location, for example at the top like WhatsApp or Messenger, and maybe move the profile picture to the bottom bar. Other than that, I find the interface very good; Signal is a combination of privacy, minimalism, and elegance.

zetabeta:

warning: third party website !
https://www.behance.net/gallery/111354521/Signal-Messaging-App-Logo-Mark-Redesign

I like the logo by designer Murat, which zetabeta mentioned, much better than the current signal logo. I could imagine it looking better as a taskbar logo, with the continuous line.

I also liked the old Textsecure logo with the keyhole symbol better, or rather, more unique.

posts.name: NIKOLAOS KRYONOGLOU
posts.cooked: This is actually the best idea right now — it looks so much more professional as an icon.

hans84:

I like the logo by designer Murat, which zetabeta mentioned, much better than the current signal logo

I don‘t. The dotted/dashed line is the defining detail of the current Logo. Without it the logo just looks like the Apple message app colored blue.
I don’t think the logo looks like the iMessage logo. The iMessage speech bubble itself is shaped differently. You could just as easily say that the current logo looks like the WhatsApp logo.
My point is about the dashed line, not the exact shape.

BearVegan:

Maybe I just became attached to it… I like it.

I very much like the dotted line too, I think it looks nice!
It somehow feels friendly to me. :)

I also think just a speech bubble with no additional details is quite boring with no real identity.
